intro: Macrolobium mayombense var. parvifolium, commonly known as the small-leaf macrolobium, is a species of flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, ovate leaves and showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
